title: Why is an interdisciplinary approach important? - Quora

response.answer_text: IDIC Infinite diversity thorough infinite combinations. The inventor is usually the last person to see all of the possibilities for tier invention. Alexander Grahm Bell thought of his telephone as a tool for business and never foresaw its domestic use. The developers of cell phones thought a camera was a silly idea, asking, “who would want a camera on a phone,” and not realizing that a lot of people would want a Phone on their camera. Bell Labs invented the transistor and thought it would be useful for hearing aids but someone else found it useful for radios and other entertainment purposes. The more eyes you have on a problem, and the wider the diversity of their education, the greater the chance you have to solve that problem.

Everything is interconnected. No discipline has all the answers because it is only a part by definition. By taking an interdisciplinary approach new ideas and connections become apparent. Once can both see how data can be viewed better and the faults of the models being used. It makes more and better qualitative predictions possible.
